prompt: <description>**CAD Assembly Instructions** **Part 1** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a square base and a rectangular top. The top is slightly offset from the base, creating a notch in the center. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0, 0, 0) with no rotation. Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. * Loop 1: + Line 1: (0, 0) to (0.75, 0) + Line 2: (0.75, 0) to (0.75, 0.75) + Line 3: (0.75, 0.75) to (0, 0.75) + Line 4: (0, 0.75) to (0, 0) * Loop 2: + Line 1: (0.1875, 0.3) to (0.5625, 0.3) + Line 2: (0.5625, 0.3) to (0.5625, 0.45) + Line 3: (0.5625, 0.45) to (0.1875, 0.45) + Line 4: (0.1875, 0.45) to (0.1875, 0.3) Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles (0, 0, 0) and translation vector (0, 0, 0). Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.0225 units to create the 3D model. **Part 2** Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The prism is centered on a white background. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0.1327, 0.2489, 0.0225) with no rotation. Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. * Loop 1: + Line 1: (0, 0) to (0.4846, 0) + Line 2: (0.4846, 0) to (0.4846, 0.2521) + Line 3: (0.4846, 0.2521) to (0, 0.2521) + Line 4: (0, 0.2521) to (0, 0) * Loop 2: + Line 1: (0.0548, 0.0511) to (0.4298, 0.0511) + Line 2: (0.4298, 0.0511) to (0.4298, 0.2011) + Line 3: (0.4298, 0.2011) to (0.0548, 0.2011) + Line 4: (0.0548, 0.2011) to (0.0548, 0.0511) Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.4846. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles (0, 0, 0) and translation vector (0, 0, 0). Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.0225 units to create the 3D model.</description>

<json>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Rectangular Prism** The CAD model for this part is a rectangular prism. **Step 1: Create a coordinate system** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. **Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch** On the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system, draw a 2D sketch. This sketch consists of two rectangles. The first rectangle is defined by the following lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.3216, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.3216, 0.0], End Point [0.3216, 0.1681] - Line 3: Start Point [0.3216, 0.1681], End Point [0.0, 0.1901] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.1901], End Point [0.0, 0.0] The second rectangle is defined by the following lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.5258, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.1681] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.1681], End Point [0.5258, 0.1681] - Line 4: Start Point [0.5258, 0.1681], End Point [0.5258, 0.0] **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. **Step 4: Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch along the normal direction by a depth of 0.0085 units. **Step 5: Describe the part** The resulting part is a rectangular prism with the following dimensions: - Length: 0.0085 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.75 units The part has a shiny, metallic surface.</description>

<description>**PART 1: A 3D model of a curved, metallic object with a rectangular cross-section** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.088, 0.0] For the sketch of the first part, create a face and then add loops to define the shape. Here's a breakdown of the sketch: 1. **Face 1:** * **Loop 1:** 1. **Line 1:** Start Point = [0.0, 0.1791]; End Point = [0.0742, 0.0] 2. **Arc 1:** Start Point = [0.0742, 0.0]; Mid Point = [0.375, 0.053]; End Point = [0.6758, 0.0] 3. **Line 2:** Start Point = [0.6758, 0.0]; End Point = [0.75, 0.1791] 4. **Arc 2:** Start Point = [0.75, 0.1791]; Mid Point = [0.375, 0.2467]; End Point = [0.0, 0.1791] Next, scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector provided by the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction to create a 3D model with the following properties: - Extrusion depth towards the normal: 0.088 - Extrusion depth opposite the normal: 0 - Sketch scaling: 0.75 - Operation: Create a new solid body. Add the following details to the description: - Shape: A 3D model of a curved, metallic object with a rectangular cross-section. - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.088 - Height: 0.75 Now the first part of the assembly has been created. Continue with the remaining parts accordingly.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Top and Bottom Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system where the euler angles are set to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector is set to [0.0, 0.5308, 0.0]. Now, create a new 2D sketch on the default X-Y plane. Draw a circle centered at (0.375, 0.375) with a radius of 0.375. This will form a single loop and face. After creating the 2D sketch, scale it uniformly using the sketch scale parameter of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch, making sure to apply the specified euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Next, extrude the 2D sketch, creating a cylindrical object with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.5308 and no extrusion in the opposite direction of the normal. The final dimensions of the part will be approximately 0.75 in length, 0.5308 in width, and 0.75 in height. Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom Design a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system where the euler angles are set to [180.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector is set to [0.6969, 0.5308, 0.0531]. Now, create a new 2D sketch on the default X-Y plane. Draw a circle centered at (0.3219, 0.3219) with a radius of 0.3219. This will form a single loop and face. After creating the 2D sketch, scale it uniformly using the sketch scale parameter of 0.6439. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch, making sure to apply the specified euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Next, extrude the 2D sketch, creating a cylindrical object with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0 and an extrusion depth opposite the normal of 0.2123. The final dimensions of the part will be approximately 0.6439 in length, 0.2123 in width, and 0.6439 in height. Part 3: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Top and Bottom (Cutout) Generate a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom, creating a cutout in the final shape. Begin by creating a new coordinate system where the euler angles are set to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector is set to [0.3206, 0.0, 0.3206]. Now, create a new 2D sketch on the default X-Y plane. Draw a circle centered at (0.0544, 0.0544) with a radius of 0.0544. This will form a single loop and face. After creating the 2D sketch, scale it uniformly using the sketch scale parameter of 0.1088. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch, making sure to apply the specified euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Next, extrude the 2D sketch, creating a cylindrical object with an extrusion depth opposite the normal of 0.5308. This will result in a tapered cutout within the final assembly. The final dimensions of the part will be approximately 0.1088 in length, 0.5308 in width, and 0.1088 in height.</description>

<description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom, and a Slightly Tapered Middle Section** *Dimensions: length - 0.6255 units, width - 0.6255 units, height - 0.0072 units* Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0659, 0.0, 0.0] Create the 2D sketch for part 1 on the XY plane of the newly created coordinate system. The sketch should consist of: * 10 lines: 1. line_1: [0.0, 0.0382] to [0.0268, 0.0138] 2. line_2: [0.0268, 0.0138] to [0.082, 0.0] 3. line_3: [0.082, 0.0] to [0.082, 0.0558] 4. line_4: [0.082, 0.0558] to [0.0531, 0.063] 5. line_5: [0.0531, 0.063] to [0.0412, 0.0738] 6. line_6: [0.577, 0.0738] to [0.5651, 0.063] 7. line_7: [0.5651, 0.063] to [0.5363, 0.0558] 8. line_8: [0.5363, 0.0558] to [0.5363, 0.0] 9. line_9: [0.5363, 0.0] to [0.5915, 0.0138] 10. line_10: [0.5915, 0.0138] to [0.6182, 0.0382] * 2 arcs: 1. arc_1: [0.0412, 0.0738] with a midpoint at [0.3091, 0.5714] to [0.577, 0.0738] 2. arc_2: [0.6182, 0.0382] with a midpoint at [0.3091, 0.6255] to [0.0, 0.0382] Close the loop by joining line_1 to line_10 and arc_1 to arc_2. Next, scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.6255 using the sketch scaling parameter. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the Euler angles and translation vectors from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with a depth of 0.0072 units towards the normal and 0 units opposite the normal, with a sketch scale of 0.6255. Perform a "New Body Feature Operation" to integrate part 1 with any preceding CAD models.</description>
